stations.dir_comment: direction the current flows toward from i.e. here flood runs W to E

stations.name: Dodd Narrows, British Columbia Current
stations.dir_comment: oddly the directions here seem reversed but it matches xtide, may be error with the api on this station?

stations.name: Boat Pass, British Columbia Current
Weynton Passage, British Columbia Current
Active Passage, British Columbia Current
Nakwakto, British Columbia Current
Sechelt Rapids, British Columbia Current
stations.COMMENT: doesnt quite match darkiri which also uses xtide, not sure why https://www.dairiki.org/tides/monthly.php/scl

stations.name: San Juan Channel (south entrance), Washington Current
Spieden Channel, north of Limestone Point
Point Richmond, East of, Colvos Passage

tide_stations.name: Kanaka Bay, South San Juan Island
Hanbury Point, North San Juan Island

sites.name: Day Island Wall
sites.data: Tacoma Narrows South, south end (midstream), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Error on late side of prediction. slack_before_flood was -30, this was often ~10min early. slack_before_ebb was -60, this resulted in reliable weak current but end of dive near slack without much reversal
sites.COMMENT2: Can drift from S entrance to N entrance on the ebb current at the beginning of a dive before a flood. Enter
sites.COMMENT3: the water about the predicted time given by the program. For dive with same entry/exit enter 10min late.
sites.COMMENT4: Can bump total speed to 6 for 2nd dive with scooter
sites.COMMENT5: SBE -90 and SBF -65 are what Marker Buoy typically use with xtide (2022-08 buoy tender)

sites.name: Skyline Wall Rosario
sites.data: Rosario Strait, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Current can be weird on low exchange days. Best to dive on medium exchanges. Recommended ebb around 1kt or greater to get expected reverse current, flood strength not very important.
sites.COMMENT2: Some say slack corresponds with Rosario slack and not much correction is needed, error on late side for entry
sites.COMMENT3: Slack before flood happens much earlier than Rosario slack, estimating 180 min early. Would be safe to dive this with scooter to get out, error on early side
sites.COMMENT4: Not a very accurate current station to plan dives by. Reference for mobilegeographics, NOAA Rosario before flood can be 1hr late

sites.name: Skyline Wall Allan Pass
sites.data: Burrows I. Allan I. Passage between, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Mobilegeographics before flood is 40min late, otherwise matches Burrows Pass very closely
sites.COMMENT2: NOAA source here is usually pretty good
sites.COMMENT3: NOAA seems to be about 20min early (or just right) and Xtide about 35min late

sites.name: Skyline Wall
sites.data: Burrows Pass, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Only dive slack before flood with scooter or really weak flood, flood runs E to W away from exit
sites.COMMENT2: BEST WAY TO PREDICT SKYLINE, but not perfect. Eric A uses this station for strength and Allen Pass for timing.
sites.COMMENT3: Error early before flood and late before ebb
sites.COMMENT4: SBF seems hard to get consistent offset for. -75 has worked for some exchanges and -40 for others.

sites.name: Keystone Jetty
sites.data: Admiralty Inlet (off Bush Point), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Slack before ebb is hard to predict, happens in middle of flood
sites.COMMENT2: Slack before flood is preference and can have long slacks
sites.COMMENT3: Enter one hour before XTide slack works well, some go even earlier. Prefer max flood less than 1.5kt, 1kt better, then can easily do
sites.COMMENT4:: dive #2 right after and not worry about current (SBE seems to hit around then). Ventusky or windy shortest range model for winds.
sites.COMMENT5:: Can drift from Driftwood Park on large (3-4kt) ebb (aim for 2kt current during dive).
sites.COMMENT6:: Jan gets in a low tide which is typically significantly earlier than the standard admiratly inlet current splash time
sites.COMMENT7:: Used to use a SBF of -31 with dive time 100
sites.COMMENT8:: Use the earlier splash time when NOAA and Xtide differ, generally they are very close

sites.name: Deception Pass
sites.data: Deception Pass (narrows), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Marker Buoy seems to have max_flood = 4.1 and max_ebb = 5.9, however NW Dive Club dives with either flood or ebb max about 5.9 and sum of the two less than 11 kts
sites.COMMENT2: North Beach opens somewhere around April 1 and closes somewhere around October 31, nightly gate closure opens ~6:45am in April (maybe earlier in summer?)
sites.COMMENT4: Jan has dove on 4.7 -> -6.0 NOAA which was 5.6 > -7.0 XTide and currents were strong and swirly but doable with good timing
sites.COMMENT5: With a large time difference in xtide & noaa (I've seen 50-90min!), reality is in the middle and usually slightly closer to NOAA
sites.COMMENT6: More time in the best parts east of bridge means error on the early side and shelter from flood once on east side, but it's very committing
sites.COMMENT7: May 2024 current limits: >8.0 NOAA and 10.0 XTide going to be 'sporty' but fine, above ~9.0 sum NOAA and ~11.0 sum XTide probably not worth it (i.e. April 14 2024 = 8.55 & 10.26 with good 85min dive but semi-short slack)
sites.COMMENT8: A west wind over 15kts in the 24hrs before a dive will result in poor vis as stirred up sand gets funnelled into the pass

sites.name: Sares Head
sites.data: Point Colville, 3.0 nm east
sites.COMMENT: Rosario Beach vis tends to be alright through 2nd-3rd week of May even when Puget Sound sites get terrible, vis can be horrible in June though
sites.COMMENT1: also reference Rosario Strait, Deception Pass, and Bowman Bay tide. SBE is preferred
sites.COMMENT2: SBE preferred since I think that will give you a ride out and back, SBF may also work or off slack on weak exchange
sites.COMMENT4: Ebb from Deception Pass is confined to the top 40ft of water and moves S to N past the outside of the island. This can be reasonably strong.
sites.COMMENT5: Ebb from Rosario Strait is moving N to S in deep water and will be felt below 60ft
sites.COMMENT6: Flood from Rosario Strait / Juan de Fuca divides near Sares Head and the northern part will flow N through Rosario Strait, the southern part will flow S to Deception

sites.name: Fox Island Bridge
sites.data: Tacoma Narrows North, north end (midstream), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Boydski says -105 before ebb correction. Marker Buoy (Justin M) does -45 to -80 before flood. NW Shore Dives: -XX before flood, -140 before ebb.
sites.COMMENT2: Flood pushes back toward exit, so it's more comfortable to error to side of flood but there is also a fine entry/exit point across the street from the boat ramp
sites.COMMENT3: SBF adjusted close based on 2/4/24 observations, not much correction needed, may still be a bit early

sites.name: Fox Island Bridge Hale
sites.data: Hale Passage, west end, Puget Sound, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: XTide Subordinate Station: 0 correction before flood and -140 before ebb compared to Narrows North, NOAA station not subordinate
sites.COMMENT2: BEST STATION FOR THIS SITE: look at both NOAA and Xtide with 0 correction and take the time in the middle of the 2 for closest to true slack
sites.COMMENT3: Xtide slack tends to be ~20min early and NOAA is ~20min late - per 2/4/2024

sites.name: Fox Island East Wall
sites.data: Tacoma Narrows South, south end (midstream), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Slack before flood in book = -56, which agrees with Marker Buoy. Many reports of hitting slack late. Needs to be earlier, estimating -105, though max speeds could perhaps be adjusted
sites.COMMENT2: Slack before ebb is tuned close, probably still a bit early, Gibson point corrections may be closer

sites.name: Fox Island East Wall Gibson
sites.data: Gibson Point, 0.8 mile east of, Puget Sound, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: XTide subordinate station to Narrows South: -24 before ebb, -33 before flood. Noaa station is not subordinate.
sites.COMMENT2: Seems pretty close, a little late on SBE and can't comment on SBF, Xtide slightly preferred although middle of xtide and noaa should be good

sites.name: Sunrise Beach
sites.data: Tacoma Narrows North, north end (midstream), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Slack before ebb of -25 aligns with Marker Buoy & NW Shore Dives. seaotter.com says -65 is better. emeralddiving.com and 151 Dives say -90
sites.COMMENT2: NW Shore Dives first slack before flood = -90 and 2nd +4 min. J Merkel has slack_before_flood = -50. Steve and Rich splash 45min before slack_before_flood.
sites.PREFERENCE: NOAA Current Station (at for slack before flood)

sites.name: Sekiu
sites.data: Strait of Juan de Fuca Entrance, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Vis is hit-or-miss and tends to be poor in summer: 9-2-18 was great, 7-2-21 was good (busy fishing), 9-29-22 was amazing, 7-30-23 was good, 10-5-24 was amazing
sites.COMMENT2: Outer reef is current sensitive. Flood runs across the bay away from exit. Ebb runs out of bay S to N as cross current. Current on far edge of kelp good proxy for further out.
sites.COMMENT3: Strait entrance seems to be better current predictor than Pillar Point. Pillar station had max flood during slack at Sekiu. Tides at Sekiu also a good approximation for current.
sites.COMMENT4: Only done the outer reef on SBE as of summer 2023. On low exchange days 2 dives there may be possible with short SI. Vis better on the flood but has outgoing current.

sites.name: Third Beach Pinnacle
sites.data: Strait of Juan de Fuca Entrance, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: SBE (Juan de fuca entrance NOAA current), which was in the middle of a tide height (neah bay) mild ebb, worked well 10/13/2024, error on the flood side since they are weaker and going safer direction
sites.COMMENT2: Can plan Cape Flattery dives with this but current there doesn't matter much

sites.name: Hoko Reef
sites.data: Pillar Point, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: NOAA preferred, ignore xtide, predictions only ever tested on SBF and true slack never really experienced, error on the earlier side, but floods tend to be weaker than ebbs
sites.COMMENT2: Also check how this compares with Sekiu tides

sites.name: Salt Creek NOAA
sites.data: Angeles Pt., 2 mi. NNE of, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Vis is hit-or-miss and tends to be poor in summer: 9-1-18 was amazing, 9-20-19 was terrible, 8-15-20 was poor (busy fishing), 9-10-21 was great, 6-11-22 was ok, 9/7/24 was amazing
sites.COMMENT1: Preferred to dive on lee side of Tongue Point (i.e. dive during flood for main entry) and with tide > 5ft. These parameters will allow diving continuously without timing entry - the only way the drive is worth it!
sites.COMMENT2: NOAA corrections are spot on for Angeles Point, this is preferred prediction source

sites.name: Salt Creek NOAA Shallow
sites.data: Angeles Pt., 2 mi. NNE of, Washington Current, depth 12ft
sites.COMMENT: Deeper station above had better current match on 9/07/24
sites.COMMENT2: More likely to have a mild flood vs deeper station that may continue to ebb or have a single ebb to ebb slack

sites.name: Salt Creek XTide
sites.data: Juan De Fuca Strait (East), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Ignore the NOAA Race Rocks predictions here - Angeles Pt is a much better source

sites.name: Ediz Hook
sites.data: Ediz Hook Light, 1.2 miles N of, Washington Current

sites.name: Point Hudson
sites.data: Point Hudson, 0.5 mile east of, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Preferred to dive during flood (especially the first half), ebbs are amplified. Use xtide, ignore noaa
sites.COMMENT2: Like Keystone: slack before flood on a lower exchange day. Don't attempt slack before ebb. It's not actually slack
sites.COMMENT3: Xtide better for now (per pnwdivers fb comments on splash time), the NOAA station is very different

sites.name: Possession Point
sites.data: Possession Sound Entrance
sites.COMMENT: Dive any time during medium to weak floods. Even strong floods are doable. Surface current typically headed south. Surface current and bad vis from river runoff typically only top 20ft of water.
sites.COMMENT2: Deep zoom has good data from xtides and another station near Mukilteo

sites.name: Waterman Wall
sites.data: Rich Passage, West end, Puget Sound, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Generally poor vis and dark when I've dove this late winter March-April
sites.COMMENT1: A flooding current can have waterfall currents, so recommended to enter close to slack before ebb
sites.COMMENT2: Slack before weak ebb seems preferred
sites.COMMENT3: Wall actually fairly protected on weak floods, NOAA current strength and XTide current timing seems best

sites.name: Warren Avenue Bridge North
sites.data: Port Washington Narrows North, Washington Current

sites.name: Warren Avenue Bridge South
sites.data: Port Washington Narrows South, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: South is probably best and NOAA probably best

sites.name: Agate Pass
sites.data: Agate Passage south end, Puget Sound, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Plan to get in 10 min before slack, swim around a bit, then ride the current to the exit
sites.COMMENT2: Current under bridge about 2 times the reading at this station. Want a 1-1.5kt ebb to ride to exit.

sites.name: Hammersley Inlet
sites.data: Hammersley Inlet, west of Skookum Point, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: 5/19 NOAA slack before flood correct within 5min, slack before ebb is preferred

sites.name: Lime Kiln Discovery
sites.data: Discovery Island, 3.3 miles NE of, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Also look at currents at PUG1718_36 (Haro Strait, 1.2 nm west of Kellett Bluff ) - Lime Kiln is halfway between
sites.COMMENT2: USE NOAA, for xtide this is a direct offset of Admiralty Inlet and not the best for planning
sites.COMMENT3: Theperfectdive says to use Discovery Island current with +76 sbf and +56 sbe for Deadman Bay
sites.COMMENT4: Definitely don't use this for planning lime kiln dives, use Haro

sites.name: Lime Kiln Haro
sites.data: South Haro Strait, south of Lime Kiln Light, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Tends to have great vis when Puget Sound sites in May & June get terrible vis
sites.COMMENT1: seems to be best source, sbe correction match over 3 days in June 2022, main channel can continue to ebb while along shore it floods
sites.COMMENT2: so a dive around min ebb is possible, watch the water direction by kelp before entry, error on early side since +40 seems like large offset from such a nearby current station
sites.COMMENT3: slack before flood is super early - based on 3 dives at Lime kiln (only 1 well timed) and 1 short one at county park
sites.COMMENT4: reference the time of low tide at Kanaka Bay and Hanbury Point on SBF dives, should start the dive about 1hr after these times
sites.COMMENT5: error on the side of diving on ebb rather than flood for scooter dives for easier exit at the rocky beach S of lighthouse
sites.COMMENT6: water flow right along shore in front of lighthouse is not a perfect indicator of diving depth current further out
sites.COMMENT7: for min ebb dives not much of a correction is needed, but this program will consider it a SBE dive with +40, can easily hop in 30min early

sites.name: Lime Kiln Admiralty
sites.data: Admiralty Inlet (off Bush Point), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: NOT preferred source, if required noaa and xtide very close, I'd prefer to go with NOAA or go with the earlier one (seems to be NOAA) and maybe snorkel in kelp if still strong
sites.COMMENT2: offsets (slack_before_flood: 76 & slack_before_ebb: 59) from 151 dives, NW shore dives, & theperfectdive: https://web.archive.org/web/20160422010100/http:/theperfectdive.com/DEF-Site.asp?sID=207
sites.COMMENT3: ^ these numbers seem to be very off compared to my personal experience in water in 2022 and 2023

sites.name: Green Point
sites.data: Green Point, 0.8 mile northwest of, Rosario Strait, Washington Current

sites.name: Goose Island
sites.data: San Juan Channel (south entrance), Washington Current

sites.name: Deadman Island
sites.data: San Juan Channel (south entrance), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Want to end this dive at slack so you dont have to fight the angle of flood hitting the island. 2000ft gear haul on trail (V and J make trip together, then J makes 1 additional trip)
sites.COMMENT2: Xtide was slightly closer to accurate on 7-14-24 and reality was between Xtide and NOAA with slack predictions 1hr apart, error on the early side and wait out the ebb at end if needed

sites.name: Spieden Channel
sites.data: Spieden Channel, north of Limestone Point
sites.COMMENT: use for approx Reuben Tarte

sites.name: Nakwakto
sites.data: Nakwakto, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: don't trust xtide, verify with Canadian current predictions too and consider slack +/- 1hr

sites.name: Sechelt Rapids
sites.data: Sechelt Rapids, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: don't trust xtide, verify with Canadian current predictions an Dariki too

sites.name: Seymour Narrows
sites.data: Seymour Narrows, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: Flood current runs south, ebb to the N
sites.COMMENT2: ALSO CHECK https://www.tides.gc.ca/en/current-predictions-station - add an hour if on Daylight Savings March - Nov since entire year in PST
sites.COMMENT3: Flood flows in from both the north and south end of Vancouver Island, meeting just south of Mitlenatch Island. So for Campbell River area, the Flood current is a southerly flow, while from Courtenay and south, the Flood is northerly.

sites.name: Whiskey Point
sites.data: Seymour Narrows, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: Flood current runs south, ebb to the N
sites.COMMENT1: Late May through end of August Campbell River, like almost everywhere else, likely has poor vis
sites.COMMENT2: Dive middle-of-the-road on SBF (drift N, then S) and end-of-the-road on SBE (drift S, then N)
sites.COMMENT3: SBE seems to last longer here even on moderate exchange, SBF is quick even on very weak exchange (151 dives book also agrees)
sites.COMMENT4: https://www.tides.gc.ca seems to be within 5min of Xtide
sites.COMMENT5: may be able to push closer to weak side when exceptionally low exchange < 4kts
sites.COMMENT7: Argo and Copper cliffs can be dove during ebb
sites.COMMENT8: Oceanfix boat seems to run dives here even on -12 -> 14kt very large exchange (def wouldn't do from shore)
sites.COMMENT9: Could increase the max speeds a little for short dives

sites.name: Argonaut Wharf
sites.data: Seymour Narrows, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: Earl like to start ~90min after turn to ebb at Seymour Narrows, it's mostly protected from ebb and not from flood
sites.COMMENT2: If ropes are set out from the big yellow buoys or the wharf then a ship is expected and don't dive it, otherwise no good way to predict if it will be used

sites.name: Gabriola Pass
sites.data: Gabriola Passage, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: Flood current runs toward the east 090, Ebb runs west 270 (degrees true) - same behavior as Deception Pass but shore entry on E side of narrows
sites.COMMENT2: Should dive on low slack before flood if doing shore entry from 49.132000, -123.699832
sites.COMMENT3: ALSO CHECK https://www.tides.gc.ca/en/current-predictions-station - add an hour if on Daylight Savings March - Nov since entire year in PST
sites.COMMENT4: On 10/13/22 Xtide was exactly correct and tides.ca predicted 27min early

sites.name: Dodd Narrows
sites.data: Dodd Narrows, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: Flood runs toward the N and ebb runs S, to consider from shore you must do on SBE

sites.name: Boat Pass
sites.data: Boat Pass, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: Use this with Saturna Channel tides for best slack in Saturna Channel, i.e. Jan. 21, 2023

sites.name: Active Pass
sites.data: Active Passage, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: Use this with Saturna Channel tides for best slack in Saturna Channel, i.e. Jan. 21, 2023

sites.name: Weynton Pass
sites.data: Weynton Passage, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: Port McNeil area dives

sites.name: Plumper Pass
sites.data: Weynton Passage, British Columbia Current
sites.COMMENT: Flood runs toward the SW, Ebb runs toward the NE, timing and params based on one SBF dive 9-20-23

sites.name: Ten Mile Point
sites.data: Discovery Island, 3.3 miles NE of, Washington Current

sites.name: Hood Canal Bridge
sites.data: Hood Canal Bridge, Puget Sound, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: NOAA info preferred, xtide is for south point

sites.name: Saltwater State Park
sites.data: Admiralty Inlet (off Bush Point), Washington Current
sites.data2: Tacoma Narrows South, south end (midstream), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Can use Browns Point current from NOAA or deepzoom.com
sites.COMMENT2: Ebb has most pronounced currents since located on the outside of the 'bend'
sites.COMMENT3: Apparently best on SBF for vis reasons (during flood and SBE is worst for vis reasons since flood mostly runs down the east side of Vashon and ebb runs mostly up west side of Vashon)

sites.name: Titlow
sites.data: Tacoma Narrows South, south end (midstream), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Club splash 1hr before slack before ebb at narrows south.

sites.name: Mukilteo
sites.data: West of Mukilteo, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Using Admiralty inlet, slack_before_flood=44 and slack_before_ebb=13

sites.name: Flagpole
sites.data: Hazel Point, Hood Canal, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Can dive during large exchanges, but will have some surface current

sites.name: Misery Point
sites.data: Hazel Point, Hood Canal, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Can dive during large exchanges, but will have current, have not experimented finding SBE and done 1 dive SBF

sites.name: Fox Island West Wall
sites.data: Tacoma Narrows South, south end (midstream), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Not current sensitive, good as 2nd dive after East Wall or Bridge

sites.name: Edmonds Underwater Park
sites.data: Admiralty Inlet (off Bush Point), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: mildly current sensitive

sites.name: Alki Junkyard
sites.data: Alki Point, 0.3 mile west of, Puget Sound, Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: Xtide probably more accurate - SBF seems 1hr late on NOAA per 5/4/24

sites.name: Redondo
sites.data: Tacoma Narrows North, north end (midstream), Washington Current
sites.COMMENT: consider moving to admiralty inlet station
sites.COMMENT2: avoid large ebbs, otherwise dive any time

sites.name: Hawea Point
sites.data: Hawea Point, Hawaii Current
sites.COMMENT: Flood runs toward the SW, Ebb runs toward the NE. Useful to look at this before heading far off Kapalua Bay

sites.name: Red Hill
sites.data: Alalakeiki Channel, Hawaii Current
sites.COMMENT: not entirely tidal driven
